Does anyone in the NY area have room later this month?

~Kelly

-----Original Message-----
From: :: anne | arun :: <life@chooseorganics .com>
Sent: Tue, 14 Oct 2008 10:50 pm
Subject: looking for a New York couch ...

hi,

ive forwarded this to a few people who have previously commented on the parenting pit, hope you dont mind getting it?

This is my shameless attempt to find somewhere to stay in New York when i am there at the end of the month. I will be there without my family so im hoping to find a couch or the like to stay on while I explore the city.�

i dont know anyone in new york (which is odd since its so bloody big) but six degrees of separation and all... i thought you might? If you do and they might be able to put up with a very house trained guest for a few days, please do forward this email to them.

thanks,

arun

ps. below is the email i sent the AlwaysUnschooled list yesterday:

hello,

im an unschooling dad from australia.

i will be in New York for 4 days at the end of the month (without my kids which is both scary & exciting).

I will be there from Oct 27 to Oct 31st. Its my first time in New York and i'm very open to ideas of what to do & see.�I'm also keen to meet up with unschooling bods in the area if anything is happening during
those dates.�

And of course if anyone happens to have a free couch for me to sleep on for that time id be eternally grateful �;)

but in any case, please let me know of any meet ups & any tips on what to see and do for that period.�

Rather than clogging up this list with stuff � if it's more appropriate please feel free to email me direct or comment on my blog.

all the best

arun

Sent: Tue, 14 Oct 2008 10:50 pm
Subject: looking for a New York couch ...








hi,



ive forwarded this to a few people who have previously commented on the parenting pit, hope you dont mind getting it?




This is my shameless attempt to find somewhere to stay in New York when i am there at the end of the month. I will be there without my family so im hoping to find a couch or the like to stay on while I explore the city. 




i dont know anyone in new york (which is odd since its so bloody big) but six degrees of separation and all... i thought you might? If you do and they might be able to put up with a very house trained guest for a few days, please do forward this email to them.




thanks,

arun




ps. below is the email i sent the AlwaysUnschooled list yesterday:








hello,




im an unschooling dad from australia.




i will be in New York for 4 days at the end of the month (without my kids which is both scary & exciting).




I will be there from Oct 27 to Oct 31st. Its my first time in New York and i'm very open to ideas of what to do & see. I'm also keen to meet up with unschooling bods in the area if anything is happening during
those dates. 




And of course if anyone happens to have a free couch for me to sleep on for that time id be eternally grateful  ;)




but in any case, please let me know of any meet ups & any tips on what to see and do for that period. 




Rather than clogging up this list with stuff – if it's more appropriate please feel free to email me direct or comment on my blog.




all the best

arun
